review: Finally got a chance to plug in the Fire TV Stick and use it. I am not happy. It has a big audio problem that needs to be fixed. In Dolby Digital Plus mode, the audio skips. In regular stereo mode, there is a continual buzzing. I am a bit of an audiophile, so I did the necessary troubleshooting. The problem exists regardless of which media is being used, as I tried NetFlix, Amazon Prime, and digital copies of movies I owned from Amazon and other services. Just to make sure it was not the HDMI slot I was using, I tried other slots and had the same problem. I even tried a different TV. Both of the TVs I use also have Dolby Digital Plus capabilities, not to mention other formats. One TV even has a receiver that decodes all of the formats (DD, DD Pro Logic II, DD Plus, DD TrueHD, DTS, DTS-HD, DTS-MA, DTS Neo:6, etc). So, it was not a format decoding issue on my end or any hardware issue outside of the Fire TV Stick itself. Basically the thing is useless for me to watch anything.
